alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 9:16PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Monroe, Choctaw, northwestern Washington, northern Clarke, Wilcox and Wayne Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 914 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles east of Barnett to 8 miles southwest of Lisman to 4 miles southwest of Pennington to near Catherine. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Thomasville, Camden, Butler, Grove Hill, Clara, Pine Hill, Lisman, Millry, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Gilbertown, Yellow Bluff and Toxey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
